t: And*p I said, “Hear*pn now, heads of Jacob And*ln rulers of the house of Israel. Is*ln it not for you to know justice?
You*ln who hate good and love evil, Who*ln tear off their skin from them And*ln their flesh from their bones,
Who*ln eat the flesh of my people, Strip*ln off their skin from them, Break*ln their bones And*ln chop them*i up as for the pot And*ln as meat in a kettle.”
Then*ln they will cry out to the Lord,*s But*ln He will not answer them. Instead,*ln He will hide His face from them at that time Because*ln they have practiced evil deeds.

Thus*p says the Lord*s concerning the prophets who lead my people astray; When*pn they have something*i to bite with their teeth, They*ln cry, “Peace,” But*ln against him who puts nothing in their mouths They*ln declare holy war.
Therefore*ln it*i will*i be*i night for you—without vision, And*ln darkness for you—without divination. The*ln sun will go down on the prophets, And*ln the day will become dark over them.
The*ln seers will be ashamed And*ln the diviners will be embarrassed. Indeed,*ln they will all cover their*i mouths Because*ln there is no answer from God.
On*ln the other hand I am filled with power— With*ln the Spirit of the Lord—*s And*ln with justice and courage To*ln make known to Jacob his rebellious act, Even*ln to Israel his sin.
Now*ln hear this, heads of the house of Jacob And*ln rulers of the house of Israel, Who*ln abhor justice And*ln twist everything that is straight,
Who*ln build Zion with bloodshed And*ln Jerusalem with violent injustice.

Her*ln leaders pronounce judgment for a bribe, Her*ln priests instruct for a price And*ln her prophets divine for money. Yet*ln they lean on the Lord*s saying, “Is*ln not the Lord*s in our midst? Calamity*ln will not come upon us.”
Therefore,*ln on account of you Zion*ln will be plowed as a field, Jerusalem*ln will become a heap of ruins, And*ln the mountain of the temple will*i become*i high places of a forest.
